messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 848
messages.msgSnippet: Cath, Charlotte Mason is more of a philosophy, there are a set of books you can buy.  Why do you feel like you do not fit in with Christian HS groups? I wear a
messages.messageBody:
Cath, Charlotte Mason is more of a philosophy, there are a set of books you
can buy. Why do you feel like you do not fit in with Christian HS groups?
I wear a covering and wear long modest dresses, and don't cut my hair
anymore, therefore I don't look like most all of the other HS moms. Some of
them are reluctant to talk to me at first, I think they may think I might be
judgemental, so I have learned to try to break the ice myself. Sometimes
you just have to be the one to reach out.
Carla Raley
Jacksboro, Texas
As for me and my house, we will serve the Lord. Joshua 24:15
----- Original Message -----
From: <benliam@...>

> obstacles in front of our
> Children's learning. Sounds kind of Unschooling to me. Charlotte Mason
> feels children,
> particularly younger children should have the afternoon off to explore.
> >>
>
> Hi there, its Cath from montreal. I have heard bits and pieces about
> Charlotte Mason---is her "package" more of a curriculum or a philosophy to
> apply or both? I too am of Christian faith. We do not HS/US for
religious
> reasons explicitly, although i can see how it fits in some ways. I find i
do
> not fit with most Christian homeschool groups though. Like many of you, i
> guess we will just find our own homeschooling path.
>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 848
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/31/00 11:13:40 AM Eastern Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/31/00 11:13:40 AM Eastern Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:

<< One of the things I gathered out of it is Jesus doesn't want us to put
obstacles in front of our
Children's learning. Sounds kind of Unschooling to me. Charlotte Mason
feels children,
particularly younger children should have the afternoon off to explore.
>>

Hi there, its Cath from montreal. I have heard bits and pieces about
Charlotte Mason---is her "package" more of a curriculum or a philosophy to
apply or both? I too am of Christian faith. We do not HS/US for religious
reasons explicitly, although i can see how it fits in some ways. I find i do
not fit with most Christian homeschool groups though. Like many of you, i
guess we will just find our own homeschooling path.
